docs.snippet: Those who said we might never see a player like Jeter anytime soon were perhaps overlooking Posey, the San Francisco Giants’ starting catcher....
docs.lead_paragraph: Those who said we might never see a player like Jeter anytime soon were perhaps overlooking Posey, the San Francisco Giants’ starting catcher.
docs.abstract: David Waldstein On Baseball column observes that San Francisco Giants' catcher Buster Posey has been compared to New Yankees' Derek Jeter; he is poised to win his third World Series in five years, one behind Jeter, who won four in his first five full seasons; reflects that a low-profile Posey has not captivated the national consciousness the way Jeter did.

headline.main: Buster Posey’s Success Recalls the Early Derek Jeter, Minus the Supermodels
headline.print_headline: Giants Catcher’s Success Recalls the Early Jeter, Minus the Supermodels

docs.snippet: The Giants are one win from the title, but eight of the last 10 teams that headed home with a 3-2 World Series deficit, including the Royals in 1985, rallied to win....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Giants are one win from the title, but eight of the last 10 teams that headed home with a 3-2 World Series deficit, including the Royals in 1985, rallied to win.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column says Kansas City Royals still have chance to take the World Series, despite being down to San Francisco Giants, 3-2; notes that eight of the last 10 teams that headed home with a 3-2 World Series deficit, including the Royals in 1985, rallied to win.

headline.seo: World Series 2014: 1985 Royals Among Teams to Overcome 3-2 Deficit
headline.main: Royals Still Like Their Chances, and So Does History
headline.print_headline: Royals Still Like Their Chances, and So Does History

docs.snippet: Game 4 on Saturday had an average of 10.7 million viewers, and Game 5 on Sunday had an average of 12.6 million....
docs.lead_paragraph: Game 4 on Saturday had an average of 10.7 million viewers, and Game 5 on Sunday had an average of 12.6 million.
docs.abstract: World Series audience remains stubbornly modest after Games 4 and 5, with viewership at less than 13 million for each game.

headline.main: Ratings for the World Series Remain on the Low Side

docs.snippet: We calculate a new index — the Matty Score — to rank the top pitchers in World Series history. Madison Bumgarner joins Christy Mathewson, Sandy Koufax and others....
docs.lead_paragraph: We calculate a new index — the Matty Score — to rank the top pitchers in World Series history. Madison Bumgarner joins Christy Mathewson, Sandy Koufax and others.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; San Francisco Giants' pitcher Madison Bumgarner now holds record for lowest career earned run average (0.29) in World Series among pitchers with at least 30 innings pitched; based on calculations from new index, called the Matty Score after top pitcher Christy Mathewson, Bumgarner is not, however, best World Series pitcher ever.

headline.seo: Madison Bumgarner, the Seventh-Best World Series Pitcher Ever
headline.print_headline: Measuring Bumgarner Against Great Series Pitchers

docs.snippet: Operators who fly drones or model planes near or over large sports stadiums and auto racetracks are breaking the law and can be fined and imprisoned for up to a year, the Federal Aviation Administration warned in a notice posted on the agency's we...
docs.lead_paragraph: Operators who fly drones or model planes near or over large sports stadiums and auto racetracks are breaking the law and can be fined and imprisoned for up to a year, the Federal Aviation Administration warned in a notice posted on the agency's website.

headline.main: Flying Drones Near Stadiums Could End in Jail Time
